title: macson
author: macson
created_time: January 02, 2023, 11:20:38 PMLast edit: April 13, 2023, 10:54:01 AM by macson
content: Quote[1] The Saudi Pro League, known as the Roshn Saudi League for sponsorship reasons, is the top division of association football in the Saudi Arabian league system. From 2013 to 2019, it was known as the Abdul Latif Jameel League, or Dawry Jameel, as it was sponsored by Abdul Latif Jameel.[2] The King Cup, officially known as The Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques' Cup, is the Saudi Arabian football knockout cup competition, run by the Saudi Arabian Football Federation. The cup was created in 1957 and was played until 1990.[3] The Saudi Super Cup is an annual super cup football match organised by the Saudi Arabian Football Federation. Founded in 2013 as a two-team competition, the current version has been contested since 2022–23 by four teams: the winners and runners-up of the King Cup and Pro League.source - WikipediaThis is the place to discuss all things related to the Saudi Arabia League[1] Saudi Pro League[2] King Cup of Champions[3] Saudi Super CupThis is a new Prediction Thread for the All Saudi Arabia League.  the Saudi Arabia league was in the spotlight of many people for a moment when C Ronaldo moved to Al Nassr.  Happy betting and happy discussions about things related to everything that will happen in the Saudi Arabia league.

comments.author: macson
comments.created_time: January 03, 2023, 03:57:04 PMLast edit: January 04, 2023, 04:55:45 PM by macson
comments.body: with the official Cristiano Ronaldo being one of Al Nassr's players, it was rumored that he would not be playing in this his inaugural match.  fans are looking forward to c ronaldo's good performance with this new team.QuoteCristiano Ronaldo could make his Al Nassr debut this week following his record-breaking £175m-a-year move to the club, with the forward reportedly jetting to Saudi Arabia on Monday ahead of his medical. Rudi Garcia's face off against Al Ta'ee at home in the Saudi Pro League on Thursday and will be keen for their new Portuguese superstar to build up some crucial minutes ahead of a top-of-the-table clash against Al Shabab next Saturday.https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11591679/Cristiano-Ronaldo-make-Al-Nassr-home-debut-versus-Al-Taee-Thursday.htmlhead to head from the two teams was quite dominated by Al Nassr's victory.https://www.fctables.com/h2h/al-nassr-fc/al-taee/

comments.author: macson
comments.created_time: January 04, 2023, 05:12:52 PMLast edit: January 12, 2023, 11:03:03 AM by macson
comments.body: the issue is PSG will face Al Nassr this month in a friendly match, is this will go to happen?  if it happens then we will see 2 GOAT fights back and i think it's like a dream come true QuoteRMC Sport report this afternoon that Paris Saint-Germain will face Al-Nassr in a friendly match later this month, the game having been scheduled as part of the league leaders’ midseason tour of Saudi Arabia last year which was cancelled due to Covid-19 concerns.https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2023/psg-to-face-al-nassr-in-friendly-this-month/

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: please close your thread and use this one Saudi Professional League 2022/2023 for further discussions about the spljust my 2 sats

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on January 04, 2023, 07:13:42 PMplease close your thread and use this one Saudi Professional League 2022/2023 for further discussions about the spljust my 2 sats I support your suggestion, it is obvious that no body is interested in discussing here.@Op, rather than being here talking to yourself alone, it is better you close this thread and do all your Saudi Arabia league related postings on the thread shared above, which appears to be more lively.Being here, posting and replying to yourself is nothing but spam, if you dont lock the thread, it might get deleted by mods at some point, so better to lock it, and maybe in the future, if you have some really important update you wish to share outside the thread mentioned above, you can share that here, and maybe by then, peeps might be interested to discuss here.jus my 2 cents as well.

comments.author: LUCKMCFLY
comments.body: The truth is that I have not been very interested in football that is from Saudi Arabia in the past, I think it is a different football, but I cannot deny that they have improved a lot, just like in African FOOTBALL I saw it as more interesting, without However, it cannot be denied that the arrival of CR7 to that football is something that attracts attention, and now I am interested in how they play, in fact when they beat Argentina in the Qatar World Cup, they captured all my attention and that was something who once told me that this type of football is growing by leaps and bounds, and I hope that football and the Arab league will have a lot of relevance.

comments.author: chigo
comments.body: Congratulations to Al Ittihad for beating Al Feiha in the Arab Super Cup final.

comments.author: Tumanggor
comments.body: Quote from: LUCKMCFLY on January 12, 2023, 05:28:06 PMThe truth is that I have not been very interested in football that is from Saudi Arabia in the past, I think it is a different football, but I cannot deny that they have improved a lot, just like in African FOOTBALL I saw it as more interesting, without However, it cannot be denied that the arrival of CR7 to that football is something that attracts attention, and now I am interested in how they play, in fact when they beat Argentina in the Qatar World Cup, they captured all my attention and that was something who once told me that this type of football is growing by leaps and bounds, and I hope that football and the Arab league will have a lot of relevance.QuoteThe existence of a player nicknamed CR7 has received scrutiny from Al Hazm coach, a club that was recently promoted to the Saudi Pro League, Filipe Gouveia. The Portuguese coach revealed that since the arrival of Cristiano Ronaldo, the Saudi Pro League has received unprecedented exposure.Currently, SPL is broadcast in 137 countries around the world. This means, many lesser-known players are now being watched by the global football audience. Then, Filipe emphasized that the presence of foreign players can have an impact on the mentality and duties of other players."Foreign players make a difference in terms of mentality, task.""That's why it's so important to find a player with the profile of Ronaldo, hard work and maximum demands, who can set an example for the Saudis."Many admit that since the arrival of CR7 to Saudi Arabia, the world's spotlight has been getting higher and now Messi is rumored to be moving to one of the big Saudi clubs, namely Al Hilal, I don't know how big the positive impact will SPL getthere are quite a lot of fights that will occur today and hopefully a lot of stakes will be involved in itdamac vs abhaal feiha vs al raedettifaq vs al fatehetc
